Context: To become an apprentice in a skilled trade at George Brown College, you must be employed in the trade and register a Contract of Apprenticeship with the Ministry of Labour, Immigration, Training and Skills Development (MLITSD). One year after registration, MLITSD will send an Offer of Training for attending the basic level of the in-school component of the apprenticeship. George Brown College's Toronto regional apprenticeship office can be contacted at (416) 326-5800. Potential applicants can sign up for college news and updates by visiting the website or contacting ask.george@georgebrown.ca. The information on this website is subject to change without notice, and students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
